definition: book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2 liu4 kai1] is roughly A4)/abbr. to 開|开[kai1]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: Book design of the first problem encountered is to determine the format of books.
sentences.chinese: 书籍设计遇到的首要问题是确定书籍的开本。

sentences.english: Some of Shakespeare's plays were published in quarto editions from 1594.
sentences.chinese: 1594年开始，莎士比亚的一些剧本以四开本出版。

sentences.english: Quarto volumes are too large to fit on this shelf.
sentences.chinese: 这架子上放不下四开本的书。

sentences.english: They are producing books in all kinds of different formats.
sentences.chinese: 他们出版各种不同开本的书籍。

definition: binding and layout (of a book etc)
the amount of books etc printed at one impression/print run
dust jacket (of a book)/protective cover/document seal
the back cover of a book
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
